headline: Raised as Feed for Empty Vessels
description: A violent psalm of purgation ‚Äî the speaker reclaims what was once consumed by others‚Äô hunger. Through naming desecration, he transforms humiliation into vow, turning the language of pain into an act of spiritual severance.
resonantThread: Ousia Bloom ‚Äî the purification arc through fire and vow
whyItMatters: It captures the sacred act of reclaiming one‚Äôs body and will from desecration. The vow, ‚ÄòI hold myself,‚Äô marks a new covenant of integrity forged through pain named without flinching.
articleExcerpt: Deceit / sucking mouths‚Äîceaseless hunger / vessels empty‚Äîfeasting / plunge through breast to the rot / ... / I do not shirk / a vow‚Äî / I hold myself.

associatedMedia.description: A heart pulsing amid ash and flame; hands red but no longer bound.
